CEHPT.title: Certified Ethical Hacking & Penetration Testing
CEHPT.Short Description: A beginner to advanced course on ethical hacking and penetration testing.
CEHPT.Description: This Course Is Aimed At Beginners Who Want To Learn Hacking And Pen-Testing From Basics. After This Course , You Will Have Good Understanding Of How To Approach A Machine And You Can Develop Your Own Methodology.
CEHPT.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed.
What you'll learn: Hardware & Microcontroller development (Arduino, Raspberry Pi, PiCo, ESP8266, NodeMCU, some sensors)

Mentor.name: karthithehacker
Mentor.title: Founder and CEO of Cappricio Securities , Ethical Hacker, Cybersecurity Researcher
Mentor.description: üë®‚Äçüè´ Meet Your Mentor: Karthikeyan V (a.k.a. Karthithehacker) Karthikeyan V is a renowned ethical hacker, cybersecurity researcher, and the founder of Cappricio Securities, a company dedicated to practical cybersecurity education. With a track record of reporting vulnerabilities in top platforms like Google, Pinterest, Android OS, and Upwork, he brings real-world experience directly into the classroom. He is the creator of several popular open-source security tools including Gh0stR3c0n, CRLFi, and Poseidon. His expertise ranges from bug bounty hunting and OSINT to advanced penetration testing and red teaming. Karthikeyan is also a popular cybersecurity content creator, known for breaking down complex topics in Tamil, making learning accessible to a wider audience. Despite coming from a modest background, his journey from a self-taught hacker to an industry leader has inspired thousands. As your mentor for the CEHPT course, he focuses on hands-on training, real-time attack simulations, and helping students develop the mindset of a professional ethical hacker. üîê ‚ÄúIn this course, I won‚Äôt just teach you tools ‚Äî I‚Äôll show you how to think like a hacker.‚Äù ‚Äî Karthikeyan V

OJIPT.title: Offensive Java and IoT Penetration Testing
OJIPT.Short Description: A deep-dive into offensive Java applications and IoT device penetration testing techniques.
OJIPT.Description: This course focuses on offensive security techniques targeting Java-based applications and IoT devices. Learners will explore real-world attack scenarios, gain hands-on experience exploiting Java vulnerabilities, and assess security weaknesses in Internet of Things ecosystems. Ideal for security professionals and developers aiming to build or break secure systems.
OJIPT.PREREQUISITES: Basic understanding of networking and HTTP. Familiarity with Linux is a plus.

CAPBB.title: Certified API Pentesting and Bug Bounty
CAPBB.Short Description: Master API penetration testing techniques and bug bounty hunting skills with a certified course focused on real-world vulnerabilities, security best practices, and ethical hacking methodologies.
CAPBB.Description: The Certified API Pentesting and Bug Bounty course is designed for cybersecurity enthusiasts and professionals aiming to specialize in API security. This course provides in-depth training on identifying, exploiting, and reporting API vulnerabilities using industry-standard tools and methodologies.
CAPBB.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed.
What you'll learn: Install and configure API testing tools like Postman and Burp Suite
Use Swagger UI and CURL for testing and debugging APIs
Understand authorization and secure header practices
Conduct blind injection, DNS exfiltration, and gain shell access
Understand and exploit CVE-2017-5487 in API contexts

CMABP.title: Certified Mobile Apps Bug-Bounty and Pen-Testing
CMABP.Short Description: A practical course on offensive mobile app security, bug bounty hunting, and real-world pen-testing techniques
CMABP.Description: This course is designed for learners aiming to master mobile application security through offensive testing techniques. You'll dive into real-world mobile threat scenarios, exploit common and advanced vulnerabilities, and develop practical skills to assess and attack mobile apps (ethically). By the end of the course, you'll be equipped to perform structured mobile app security assessments and contribute effectively to bug bounty programs..
CMABP.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed, Android studio for malware development.
What you'll learn: Understand Mobile application's security principles and potential dangers
As a Mobile application developer you will understand how to secure your application

CCI.title: Certified Cyber Crime Investigation
CCI.Short Description: This course is aimed at beginners who want to learn hacking and pen-testing from basics.
CCI.Description: This course is designed for beginners who want to learn ethical hacking and cyber crime investigation from scratch. After completing this course, you will understand the fundamentals of hacking, penetration testing, and digital investigation, enabling you to approach real-world scenarios confidently and build your own investigation and testing methodology.
CCI.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed.
What you'll learn: Cyber awareness with cyber safe tips

CHID.title: Certified Hardware & IOT Developmental Hacking
CHID.Short Description: This course is aimed at beginners who want to learn how Hardware works and IoT Development from basics.
CHID.Description: This course is designed to learn how hardware works and IoT development. It covers the process of developing IoT products with the help of hardware devices that can be remotely controlled and can be used to monitor the connected product's condition or environment via sensors and external data sources.
CHID.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed.

CWBP.title: Certified Web Apps Pen-Testing & Bug-Bounty
CWBP.Short Description: A beginner to advanced course on Web Apps Pen-Testing & Bug-Bounty
CWBP.Description: This Course Is Aimed At Beginners Who Want To Learn Hacking And Pen-Testing From Basics. After This Course , You Will Have Good Understanding Of How To Approach A Machine And You Can Develop Your Own Methodology.
CWBP.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed.
What you'll learn: Identifying and exploiting misconfigured HTTP headers
Discovering rate limiting issues in APIs
Identifying CSRF on real-world web applications
Hands-on proof-of-concept demos for each vulnerability

CHIP.title: Certified Hardware & IOT Pen-Testing
CHIP.Short Description: This course focuses on IoT research and hardware reversing.
CHIP.Description: This course is primarily focused on research works on IoT presenting and Hardware Reversing
CHIP.PREREQUISITES: Basic understanding of networking and HTTP. Familiarity with Linux is a plus.
What you'll learn: Hardware configuration essentials for IoT hacking
Sniff and analyze data from IoT devices
Performing critical remote attacks on IoT devices
Demonstrations of vulnerabilities and how to exploit them

CTDPJ.title: Cyber Security Tool Development Using Python & Js
CTDPJ.Short Description: This course focuses on CLI Tool DEvelopment Using Python & Js.
CTDPJ.Description: In this course, you will learn to develop powerful CLI tools for cybersecurity using Python and Node.js. This hands-on program focuses on building command-line applications tailored for penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and automation in security workflows.
CTDPJ.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed.

CPPI.title: Certified Physical Device Pen-Testing & IOT Hacking
CPPI.Short Description: this Course is focusing on how to hack real-world devices and secure it.
CPPI.Description: This course is designed to focus on Physical Device Pen-Testing & IOT Hacking.It focuses on how to hack real-world devices and secure it.
CPPI.PREREQUISITES: Basic PC/Laptop familiarity. No coding experience needed.
What you'll learn: Set up and configure hardware for IoT security testing
Perform data sniffing on IoT devices
Pentest magnetic stripe cards (e.g., ATM cards)
